body_html: @apaszke My very preliminary (and possibily wrong) understanding of jit tracer is that it traces individual autograd Functions as a graph. Since we don't have <IndexBackwardBackward>, it seems difficult to identify consecutive IndexBackward because each is composed by two other ops zeros + copy_.
body_text: @apaszke My very preliminary (and possibily wrong) understanding of jit tracer is that it traces individual autograd Functions as a graph. Since we don't have <IndexBackwardBackward>, it seems difficult to identify consecutive IndexBackward because each is composed by two other ops zeros + copy_.
body: @apaszke My very preliminary (and possibily wrong) understanding of jit tracer is that it traces individual autograd Functions as a graph. Since we don't have `<IndexBackwardBackward>`, it seems difficult to identify consecutive `IndexBackward` because each is composed by two other ops `zeros + copy_`.
